text: The Peugeot 206 is a car made by the French company Peugeot. It was produced from 1998 to 2013 in Europe. The car was sold in many countries around the world, with production still happening in some places even after 2013. It is a small, compact car that became very popular for its design, fuel efficiency, and affordable price. ==History== The Peugeot 206 was introduced in 1998 as the successor to the Peugeot 205. It was designed to be a small city car, but it became popular for its versatility and style. The 206 was available in many different versions, such as a 3-door and 5-door hatchback, convertible, and estate (station wagon) model. It was sold in many countries, including Europe, Latin America, and parts of Asia. In 2006, the Peugeot 207 replaced the 206 in many markets, but the 206 continued to be sold as a budget model. In 2009, a new version called the Peugeot 206+ was introduced with some updates to the design and features. However, this updated model was not sold in the UK. ==Engine Options== The Peugeot 206 was available with various engine options, depending on the model and market. Common engine sizes included: 1.1 L (60 hp) 1.4 L (75 hp) 1.6 L (88 hp) 2.0 GTI (136 hp) 2.0 RC (177 hp) There were also diesel engine options, including 1.4 L HDi (68 hp) and 1.6 L HDi (109 hp), which were known for their fuel efficiency, 1.9 D and 2.0 HDi. ==Design== The Peugeot 206 was known for its compact and modern design. It featured smooth, rounded edges with a body style that appealed to many drivers. The interior was simple, offering enough space for small families or individuals. The car was available in different colors and trims, and some models had sportier designs.
